page.title: 04HOUSING IN M.W./SHIPT.
page.content: The centre of Market Weighton was mainly rebuilt between l780-l850 in brick with pantile roof; only a small number had slate roofs. Increased traffic early in the 20th century led to demolition and deterioration of property. Most of the derelict and sub-standard housing had been demolished by l985. New developments of brick and tile occurred off all major roads and these were insular by nature as no connecting roads or footpaths were incorporated in the plans. The latest housing trend for small town houses suitable for first time buyers or pensioners, this spate of new building seems to have abated for the time being. Approx. 66% of the 1,373 properties were owner occupied and the remainder were mainly Council owned.
